The first version of the Eltex Social Media application has been released. The application is a social network that will allow users to create posts and events, indicate their places of work.\n\nThe version has been updated to stable version 1.0.2. Fixes: animation of avatar loading, switching to the system language in the application settings.

Updates:

• Added the ability to compress the image size before sending: the image metadata is deleted, and the image resolution is optimized.

• The backend application runs on its own server.

• The application usage rules and the user agreement have been added.

• Animations and UI components in the app have been updated.

A new version of the app has been released 2.0!

Major updates:

• Added comments to posts. Share your opinion and information with other users of the app under the posts!

Additional changes:

• Animations and some of the visual content have been redesigned.

• The application has been optimized and bugs fixed.
Rules for Using the Social Media Network
1.1. The social media network (hereinafter referred to as the "Platform") provides users with the ability to exchange information, create content, and interact with other users.
1.2. By using the Platform, you agree to these Rules and undertake to comply with them.
1.3. The Platform Administration reserves the right to change the Rules without prior notice.
2.1. To use the Platform, you must register an account.
2.2. During registration, the user is required to provide accurate information.

2.3. The following is prohibited:
• Creating multiple accounts for one user.
• Using someone else's data for registration.
• Registering accounts on behalf of legal entities without the Administration's approval.
2.4. The user is responsible for ensuring the security of their account. In case of lost access, the Administration must be notified immediately.
3.1. Users can publish text posts, images, videos, and other materials (hereinafter referred to as "Content").

3.2. It is prohibited to publish Content that:
• Violates the laws of the user's country of residence.
• Contains profanity, insults, or threats.
• Promotes violence, discrimination, or extremism.
• Contains adult content (18+).
• Violates the copyrights of third parties.
3.3. The user is fully responsible for the Content they publish.
3.4. The Administration reserves the right to remove Content that violates the Rules without warning.
4.1. Users can comment, like, and share other users\' Content.

4.2. The following is prohibited:
• Posting offensive or provocative comments.
• Distributing spam or advertising without the Administration's approval.
• Using the Platform to harass or bully other users.
4.3. Users can block other users if their actions cause discomfort.
5.1. Users can create events and invite other users.

5.2. An event must include:
• A title.
• A description.
• The date and time of the event.
• A link to the source (if applicable).

5.3. It is prohibited to create events that:
• Violate the law.
• Contain false information.
• Promote illegal activities.
6.1. Users can specify companies where they have worked or are currently working.

6.2. Information about the company must include:
• The company's name.
• The user's position.
• A link to the company's official website (if available).
6.3. The following is prohibited:\n• Providing false information about the company or position.\n• Using company information for advertising without the Administration\'s approval.
7.1. The Platform is committed to protecting users\' personal data.
7.2. The user agrees to the processing of their data within the Platform\'s functionality.
7.3. The following is prohibited:\n• Sharing other users\' personal data without their consent.\n• Using user data for commercial purposes.

8.1. In case of violations of the Rules, the Administration may:
• Issue a warning.
• Remove Content.
• Block the account.
8.2. The user may appeal the Administration\'s actions by contacting support.

1.2. The Platform is provided "as is." The Administration does not guarantee uninterrupted operation or the absence of errors.

3.1. The Administration has the right to:

• Block the accounts of violators.
• Make changes to the Platform's functionality.
3.2. The Administration is required to:\n• Ensure the Platform\'s functionality.\n• Protect users\' personal data.
4.1. The user is responsible for their actions on the Platform.
4.2. The Administration is not responsible for Content posted by users.
5.1. This Agreement is governed by the laws of the country where the Platform is registered.
5.2. All disputes are resolved through negotiations. If an agreement cannot be reached, the dispute is referred to court.
